title: MJ vs LeBron: The metrics finally settle it

hook.text:
The GOAT debate: Michael Jordan vs LeBron James. Forget the eye test.

[On-screen: "LET THE MATH DECIDE 🐐"]

Here's what TUSG% and PVR actually say...

explanation.text:
MJ 1987-88: 40.13 TUSG%, 15.54 PVR (35 PPG in a fast-paced era)
LeBron 2012-13: 31.03 TUSG%, 39.21 PVR (27 PPG, elite efficiency)

[Show comparison graphic]

MJ = Higher volume, dominated the ball more
LeBron = Lower volume, INSANE efficiency, better playmaking

Different eras, different styles. MJ's peak usage vs LeBron's peak efficiency.

example.text:
Translation: MJ took over games with scoring. LeBron elevated everyone.

[Show: MJ's 35 PPG vs LeBron's 27 PPG + 7.3 APG]

Both are top 15 all-time in their respective metrics. The math says: they're BOTH the GOAT.

cta.text:
Still think there's one answer? Link in bio for the full cross-era rankings. Follow for more debates settled by data.

[End screen: "BOTH GOATS 🐐🐐"]

Keep energy high - fast cuts, dynamic visuals
Test different hooks for best performance
